info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 5:25PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Prince Edward, northern Lunenburg and Nottoway Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 525 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rehoboth, or 7 miles southeast of Keysville, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Blackstone, Crewe, Victoria, Nottoway, Lunenburg, Burkeville, Rehoboth, Green Bay, Arvins Store, Twin Lakes State Park, Nutbush, Burkes Tavern, Scholfield, The Falls, Wellville, Pleasant Grove, Fergusonville, Jennings Ordinary, Meherrin and Prince Edward Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
